title: Update : Israeli army says kills senior commander in Lebanese Islamic organization - Xinhua
message:
JERUSALEM, May 17 (Xinhua) -- The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) on Friday said it killed Sharhabil Ali al-Sayed, a senior commander in the Lebanese Islamic Group, or Jamaa Islamiya, in an airstrike on the area of Majdal Anjar village in southeastern Lebanon.
"Al-Sayed has recently led many attacks and acts of terrorism from Lebanese territory against Israel in the eastern sector, in cooperation with the Lebanese Hamas branch," the IDF said in a statement.
The statement noted that the operation was carried out "to harm the organization's ability to promote and carry out terrorist operations that it planned in the recent period and in the near future against Israel on the northern border."
Earlier in the day, the IDF reported that 75 launches of rockets and drones were carried out from Lebanon into northern Israel.
Meanwhile, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua on Friday that an Israeli drone followed a four-wheel drive vehicle that was driving in the town of Rashaya, fired two air-to-surface missiles at it, burning the car and killing its driver, Sharhabil al-Sayed, and seriously wounding his companion and a civilian who happened to be at the scene.
event_breakdown:
Security events:
- The IDF killed Sharhabil Ali al-Sayed, a senior commander in the Lebanese Islamic group, in airstrike on southeastern Lebanon.
- IDF launched 75 rockets and drones from Lebanon into northern Israel.
- An Israeli drone followed a four-wheel drive car in Rashaya, fired 2 air-to-surface missiles, killing Sharhabil al-Sayed and wounding two people.

title: IDF Finds Loaded Rocket Launchers in Rafah
message:
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) has found loaded rocket launchers during its operation in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip, now in its second week.
These launchers were used by the terrorist organizations in the Gaza Strip to launch rockets toward Israel in recent months.
The rocket launchers were destroyed by the IDF.
In another targeted raid, the soldiers located significant rocket launch infrastructure in the Rafah area and rockets ready to be launched.
The fact that the IDF is discovering and destroying rocket launchers provides further justification for the ongoing Rafah operation, to which the Biden administration and much of the international community has objected.

title: Israeli strikes kill at least five in Lebanon , including two children
message:
Israeli strikes on southern and eastern Lebanon killed at least five people yesterday including two children, security sources and Unicef said.Israel and Lebanese armed group Hezbollah have been exchanging fire across Lebanon’s southern border for seven months in parallel with the Gaza war.
Other Lebanese factions as well as Palestinian groups have also fired rockets at Israel from Lebanon.Yesterday, a series of Israeli strikes on a coastal town further north than the usual conflict area killed a Hezbollah member as well as two Syrian civilians, the security sources said.
Unicef Lebanon separately said two children were killed in an Israeli strike on Friday.A separate Israeli strike on Majdal Anjar, on Lebanon’s eastern border with Syria, killed Sharhabil al-Sayed, a member of Palestinian group Hamas who was in charge of the faction’s operations in Lebanon’s eastern Bekaa Valley, according to two security sources.The strike also killed another Palestinian Hamas member, the sources said.The Israeli military said its forces struck a Hezbollah launcher and military infrastructure in southern Lebanon and confirmed the death of al-Sayed.It said sirens warning of incoming rockets and hostile aircraft sounded in several communities throughout yesterday and at one point identified 75 launches crossing from Lebanon into Israel.
It said dozens of the launches were intercepted and there were no immediate reports of deaths or damage.
The exchanges of fire between armed groups in Lebanon and the Israeli military have ramped up in recent days.
event_breakdown: Israeli strikes in southern and eastern Lebanon killed five people, including a Hezbollah member and two Palestinian members of Hamas, including two Syrian children.

title: Israel Hamas war : IDF finds bodies of three hostages in Gaza
message:
Jerusalem, Cairo: The Israeli military said its troops in Gaza found the bodies of three Israeli hostages killed by Hamas during its October 7 attack, including German-Israeli Shani Louk.
The military identified the other two bodies as those of a 28-year-old woman, Amit Buskila, and a 56-year-old man, Itzhak Gelerenter.
The Israeli military said its troops in Gaza found the bodies of the three Israeli hostages.
Credit: Hostages Families Forum Headquarters via APAll three were killed by Hamas while fleeing the Nova music festival, an outdoor dance party near the Gaza border, where militants killed hundreds of people, military spokesman Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari said at a news conference.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called the deaths “heartbreaking,” saying, “We will return all of our hostages, both the living and the dead.”

2. The three were killed by Hamas while fleeing the Nova music festival near the Gaza border.
3. On October 7, militants killed hundreds of people at the music festival.

title: Yemen Houthi rebels claim shooting down another US MQ - 9 Reaper drone
message:
Yemen's Houthi rebels on Friday claimed to have shot down an American drone, hours after footage circulated online of what appeared to be the wreckage of an MQ-9 Reaper drone.
Gen. Yahya Saree claimed that rebels shot down the Reaper on Thursday with a surface-to-air missile.
He described the drone as "carrying out hostile actions" in Yemen's Marib province, which remains held by allies of Yemen's exiled, internationally recognized government.
Online video showed wreckage resembling the pieces of the Reaper on the ground, as well as footage of that wreckage on fire.
Houthi attacks have dropped in recent weeks as the rebels have been targeted by a U.S.-led airstrike campaign in Yemen.
event_breakdown: Houthi rebels claim to have shot down an American drone in Yemen. (Unconfirmed)

title: SC allows prosecution of HM operatives in Banihal attack
message:
The Supreme Court drew parallels between the unsuccessful attack on the CRPF convoy and the deadly 14 February 2019 Pulwama attack, which claimed the lives of 40 CRPF personnel.
The Pulwama attack was perpetrated by a suicide bomber affiliated with the Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM).
On March 30, 2019, individuals suspected to be members of Hizbul Mujahideen attempted to execute an attack on a CRPF convoy in Banihal along the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway.
Following the Pulwama attack, the Union Home Ministry transferred the investigation of the attempted ambush on the CRPF convoy to the NIA.
Naikoo, one of Kashmir’s most wanted terrorists and the commander of Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) was killed during an encounter in Pulwama in May 2020.
event_breakdown:
,
Security Events:

1. Pulwama Attack - 14 February 2019: JeM suicide bomber targets CRPF convoy in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, killing 40 personnel.
2. Attempted Ambush on CRPF Convoy - 30 March 2019: Hizbul Mujahideen militants try to execute an attack on a CRPF convoy in Banihal, Jammu-Srinagar National Highway.
3. Transfer of Investigation to NIA - March 2019: Union Home Ministry transfers the investigation of the attack to the NIA.
4. Encounter in Pulwama - May 2020: Naikoo, a commander of Hizbul Mujahideen, one of the most wanted terrorists in Kashmir, is killed in Pulwama.

title: 7 soldiers injured after blast in St . Petersburg military academy
message:
Image Source: IANS NewsSt. Petersburg, May 18 : Seven soldiers were injured after a World War II-era munition exploded in the Military Academy of the Signal Corps in St. Petersburg, Russia's Leningrad Military District said.
The explosion occurred on Friday during the cleaning of one of the basement premises when people unloaded garbage into a container, the district's press office was quoted as saying by Xinhua news agency.
A 76-millimeter World War II-era munition "arbitrarily detonated", the press office said.
The wounded have been taken to the Defense Ministry's health facility, according to the press office.
Governor of St. Petersburg Alexander Beglov has denied that the incident was terrorist-related.
event_breakdown:
* Seven soldiers were injured after a World War II-era munition exploded in the Military Academy of the Signal Corps in St. Petersburg, Russia's Leningrad Military District said

title: Yemen Houthi rebels claim shooting down another US MQ - 9 Reaper drone as footage shows wreckage
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — Yemen's Houthi rebels on Friday claimed to have shot down an American drone, hours after footage circulated online of what appeared to be the wreckage of an MQ-9 Reaper drone.
Gen. Yahya Saree claimed that rebels shot down the Reaper on Thursday with a surface-to-air missile.
He described the drone as “carrying out hostile actions" in Yemen's Marib province, which remains held by allies of Yemen's exiled, internationally recognized government.
The Houthis later released footage they claimed showed the surface-to-air-missile being launched at night, along with night-vision footage of the missile hitting the drone.
Houthi attacks have dropped in recent weeks as the rebels have been targeted by a U.S.-led airstrike campaign in Yemen.
event_breakdown:
List of Security Events
1. Houthi rebels in Yemen claim to have shot down an American drone on July 7, 2022.
2. The incident occurred in Marib province, where Yemen's internationally recognized government still holds territory.

message:

Russian forces recently marginally advanced near Avdiivka.

title: Two police officers who took a two - hour break to get a kebab on the night of the Manchester Arena attack which left 22 dead are given final written warnings
message:
Two police officers who drove away for a kebab on a two-hour break on the night of the Manchester Arena terror attack have been handed final written warnings.
The Manchester Arena Inquiry had heard that suicide bomber Salman Abedi may have been challenged if a British Transport Police (BTP) officer had been present.
An investigation into the BTP officers was launched following a complaint by families of the victims relating to evidence heard at the inquiry.
PC Jessica Bullough and PC Mark Renshaw went on a 10-mile round trip to buy kebabs on the night of the Manchester Arena attack.
Another BTP officer who was the subject of the complaint retired before the investigation began.

title: Slovakia Reels from PM Shooting as Suspect Goes to Court
message:
The suspect charged with the attempted murder of Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico is expected on Saturday before a penal court that will decide whether to hold him in pre-trial detention.
The man, identified by Slovak media as 71-year-old poet Juraj Cintula, fired five shots at Fico on Wednesday and hit him four times.
The shooting occurred as Fico was walking towards his supporters after a government meeting in the central Slovak town of Handlova.
AdvertisementA prosecutor proposed on Friday that Cintula be placed in pre-trial detention after he had been charged with a premeditated murder attempt.
Advertisement"All these lies are the main reason why Robert Fico is fighting for his life today," he said in an emotional message on Smer's website.
event_breakdown: - A man, identified as 71-year-old poet Juraj Cintula, fired five shots at Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico on Wednesday and hit him four times. - The shooting occurred as Fico was walking towards his supporters after a government meeting in the central Slovak town of Handlova. - A prosecutor proposed on Friday that Cintula be placed in pre-trial detention after he had been charged with premeditated murder attempt.

title: Rocket shell and mine explosion kill 3 children in Balkh and Badghis
message:
Officials and local sources in the provinces of Balkh and Badghis have confirmed that three children were killed and another injured due to the explosion of a rocket shell and landmine remnants from past conflicts in these provinces.
Mohammad Essa Wasiq, the spokesperson for the police command in Balkh province, announced in a statement that the incident occurred on Friday, May 17th, in the village of Alam Khil, Balkh district.
The statement mentioned that the explosion happened while three children were playing with a war remnant shell.
Additionally, local sources in Badghis province reported an explosion of a war remnant mine in the Qadis district of this province.
Reports indicate that this explosion took place in the village of Juwalq, Qadis district, resulting in the death of a 17-year-old teenager.
event_breakdown:
.
1. Three children were killed and another injured due to the explosion of a rocket shell in Balkh province.
2. The explosion of a war remnant mine in Badghis province resulted in the death of a 17-year-old teenager.

title: 3 Spanish nationals killed in shooting in Afghanistan : Official
message:
Bamyan : , May 18 (IANS) Three foreign nationals were killed in a shooting attack in central Afghanistan's Bamyan province.
The victims are confirmed to be Spanish, two of them women, a local police official said on Saturday.
Four foreign nationals were also wounded in the attack, respectively, from Spain, Norway, Australia, and Lithuania, Xinhua news agency reported.
Out of the four foreigners, two were women, Bamyan's provincial police spokesperson Muhammad Khawani Rasa told Xinhua.
Besides the foreign nationals, one Afghan was killed while three others were injured in the shooting attack, Ministry of Interior Affairs Spokesperson Mufti Abdul Mateen Qani said on social media platform X on Friday.
event_breakdown:
- Shooting attack in Bamyan, Afghanistan, three foreign nationals killed, Spanish, Norwegian, Australian, and Lithuanian nationals among the wounded.
- An Afghan was killed, and three others injured.

title: Look at assassinations and assassination attempts this century
message:
Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico was seriously wounded in an apparent assassination attempt just weeks before a Europe-wide election that has been deeply divisive.
Here's a global look at other notable assassinations and assassination attempts during the 21st century:— Sept. 1, 2022: Argentina's then-Vice President Cristina Fernández is targeted by a man who reportedly aimed a handgun at point-blank range toward the politician in what government ministers characterize as an assassination attempt.
— Nov. 6, 2021: Iraqi Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi survives an assassination attempt when two armed drones target his residence in Baghdad's Green Zone area.
— Feb. 14, 2005: Lebanese Prime Minister Rafik Hariri is killed by a suicide truck bomb on a seaside boulevard in Beirut.
— March 12, 2003: Serbian Prime Minister Zoran Djindjic is shot dead in front of the Serbian government headquarters in Belgrade.
event_breakdown:
.
— June 28, 2022: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico survives an assassination attempt just weeks before a Europe-wide election that has been deeply divisive.
— Sept. 1, 2022: Argentina's then-Vice President Cristina Fernández survives an assassination attempt in Buenos Aires.
— Nov. 6, 2021: Iraqi Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi survives an assassination attempt in the Iraqi capital of Baghdad.
— March 14, 2005: Lebanese Prime Minister Rafik Hariri is killed in a suicide bombing in Beirut.

message:
Hamas is not unique in taking hostages, although its genocidal fury and the sheer number of hostages seized are unique.
Biden’s new redline is the protection of non-combatants but offers no solution for winning against an enemy that uses hostages to maximize collateral damage.
Once, Western nations recognized that there was a price to pay for stealing enemy civilians as pawns in war.
And because we no longer know where to assign moral blame for hostage-taking, it’s a factor in breaking apart Western civilization.
I fear that the mass hostage-taking in Israel signifies a new chapter in the history of taking hostages.
event_breakdown:
1. Hamas takes hostages in Israel.
2. Western nations used to recognize there was a price to pay for stealing enemy civilians as pawns in war.
3. President Biden sets a new redline for protecting non-combatants.
4. The solution offered for preventing more hostages from being seized is not effective.
5. Hamas uses hostages to maximize collateral damage.
6. The mass hostage-taking in Israel signifies a new chapter in the history of taking hostages.

message:

title: Rocket Shell And Mine Explosion Kill 3 Children In Balkh And Badghis
message:
(MENAFN- Khaama Press) Officials and local sources in the provinces of Balkh and Badghis have confirmed that three children were killed and another injured due to the explosion of a rocket shell and landmine remnants from past conflicts in these provinces.
Mohammad Essa Wasiq, the spokesperson for the police command in Balkh province, announced in a statement that the incident occurred on Friday, May 17th, in the village of Alam Khil, Balkh district.
The statement mentioned that the explosion happened while three children were playing with a war remnant shell.
Additionally, local sources in Badghis province reported an explosion of a war remnant mine in the Qadis district of this province.
Reports indicate that this explosion took place in the village of Juwalq, Qadis district, resulting in the death of a 17-year-old teenager.
location: The main event is in the village of Alam Khil, Balkh district of Afghanistan.
event_breakdown:
Events:
- Explosion of a rocket shell in Alam Khil village, Balkh district, Afghanistan
- Explosion of a landmine remnant in the Qadis district of Badghis province, Afghanistan
- Three children were killed, and another injured, due to explosions of the two war remnants
- A 17-year-old teenager was killed in the Qadis district of Badghis province

title: Fighting rages in Gaza Rafah after first aid delivery via pier
message:
Heavy clashes and bombardment Saturday rocked Gaza's southern city of Rafah, witnesses said, as the Israeli military announced the first 310 pallets of humanitarian aid had entered the besieged territory via a U.S.-built pier.
More than 10 days into what the Israeli military called a "limited" operation in Rafah, fighting between Israeli forces and Palestinian militants has also flared again in Gaza's north.
The 310 pallets began moving ashore in "the first entry of humanitarian aid through the floating pier," the Israeli army said in a statement.
In the coming days, around 500 tons of aid are expected to be delivered to Gaza through the pier, according to U.S. Central Command.
Amid the aid shortages, the Israeli army said "dozens of Israeli civilians" set fire to a Gaza-bound aid truck in the occupied West Bank on Thursday night, in the second such attack in a week.
event_breakdown:
Security events:
- Heavy clashes and bombardment shook Gaza's southern city of Rafah.
- The military operation in Rafah, which the Israeli military calls a "limited" operation, has lasted more than 10 days.
- Heavy clashes and bombardment also took place in the Gaza's north.
- The first 310 pallets of humanitarian aid entered Gaza via a U.S.-built pier.
- In the second attack in a week, dozens of Israeli civilians set fire to a Gaza-bound aid truck in the occupied West Bank.

title: Ukraine can still beat Russia . It just comes down to enough Western aid .
message:
With 14 to 21 well-equipped brigades, Ukraine could eject Russian forces from all Ukrainian territory, according to an American expert.
One is Ukraine amassing a sufficiently powerful ground combat force that can defeat the estimated 500,000 Russian troops in Ukraine.
An ill-prepared Ukrainian counteroffensive in summer 2023 sputtered amid Russian minefields and inexperienced Ukrainian troops struggling to master newly arrived Western combat vehicles.
Given sufficient quantities of munitions, Ukraine could inflict enough losses to decisively attrit Russian forces that have already sustained an estimated 500,000 casualties.
Even this doesn't cover all the items Ukraine would need, such as air defense weapons for the front-line troops, Bohnert noted.

3. A sufficient quantity of munitions could inflict enough losses to decisively attrite Russian forces in Ukraine, which have sustained an estimated 500,000 casualties.
4. Ukraine still lacks sufficient air defense weapons for the front-line troops, as noted by Bohnert.

title: Three Spanish nationals killed in Afghan Bamyan shooting
message:
Three Spanish nationals killed in Afghan's Bamyan shootingKabul, May 18 (UNI) The three foreign nationals who died in a shooting attack in central Afghanistan's Bamyan province on Friday have been confirmed to be Spanish, two of them women, a local police official said on Saturday.
Four foreign nationals were also wounded in the attack, respectively from Spain, Norway, Australia, and Lithuania.
Of them, two were women, Bamyan's provincial police spokesperson, Muhammad Khawani Rasa, told Xinhua.
Besides the foreign nationals, one Afghan was killed while three other Afghans were injured in the shooting attack, spokesperson for the Ministry of Interior Affairs Mufti Abdul Mateen Qani said on social media platform X on Friday.
Four suspects have been arrested, Qani added.
event_breakdown:
1. A shooting attack occurred in central Afghanistan's Bamyan province on May 18, 2023.
2. The attack killed three Spanish nationals and wounded four more foreign nationals.
3. In addition to the three Spanish nationals killed, two other foreign nationals were wounded, respectively from Norway, Australia, and Lithuania.
4. Four suspects have been arrested in connection with the shooting attack.
5. One Afghan was also killed and three more were wounded in the attack.

title: Fighting rages in Gaza Rafah after first aid delivery via pier
message:
May 18, 2024 — Rafah (Palestinian Territories) (AFP)Heavy clashes and bombardment Saturday rocked Gaza's southern city of Rafah as the Israeli military announced the first humanitarian aid had entered the besieged territory via a US-built pier.
The Israeli army said 310 pallets began moving ashore in "the first entry of humanitarian aid through the floating pier".
- Rafah operation hampers aid -In the coming days, around 500 tonnes of aid are expected to be delivered to Gaza through the pier, according to US Central Command.
The European Union welcomed the first shipment from Cyprus to the Gaza pier, but called on Israel to "expand deliveries by land and to immediately open additional crossings".
The Rafah crossing, a vital conduit for humanitarian assistance, has been closed since the Israeli Rafah operation began early last week.
event_breakdown: Heavy clashes and bombardment occurred in Rafah, Gaza's southern city. The Israeli army began moving humanitarian aid to Gaza, and the EU and Israel welcomed it, but called for additional crossings to be opened. The Rafah crossing has also been closed since the beginning of the Israeli raid last week.

title: One Palestinian killed , eight others wounded in an Israeli raid in the West Bank
message:
A Palestinian militant was killed and eight other people were wounded on Friday in an Israeli airstrike on the Jenin refugee camp in the occupied West Bank, the Palestinian Authority’s health ministry and the Israel Defense Forces said.
The armed section of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad group said the militant who died was a member of the group and was named Islam Hamaisa.
According to the Palestinian Authority’s Ministry of Health, the eight wounded were evacuated and are being treated in stable condition in hospitals.
The Israeli armed forces said the raid was carried out by a fighter jet and a helicopter.
It was a rare operation of this kind in the occupied West Bank, where violence had already escalated well before the Israeli/Hamas war broke out in the Gaza Strip on 7 October.

* A Palestinian militant, Islam Hamaisa, and eight other individuals, were wounded by an Israeli airstrike in Jenin refugee camp in West Bank on Friday
* Hamaisa was a member of Palestinian Islamic Jihad
* That's a rare operation of Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank

title: Two children among four dead in Lebanon strikes blamed on Israel
message:
May 17, 2024 — Beirut (AFP)Strikes in Lebanon blamed on Israel killed four people Friday including two children and a local Hamas official, state media and a source close to the Palestinian group said.
The NNA said two Syrian children were killed in the Najjariyeh strike, identifying them as Osama and Hani al-Khaled.
The United Nations children's agency UNICEF said on X that "two children were killed in an air strike in southern Lebanon," adding: "Protection of children is an obligation under the international humanitarian law."
The Israeli army statement said that "Hezbollah's aerial defence array deliberately operates from within civilian areas, thus endangering the lives of civilians in southern Lebanon".
The Israeli army said that "approximately 75 launches were identified crossing from Lebanon into Israeli territory, dozens of which were intercepted".
event_breakdown:
Here is a summary of the security events discussed:
- 4 people, including 2 children, were killed in strikes in Lebanon.
- UNICEF indicated the death of 2 children.
- Israeli forces fired missiles into Lebanon.
- Israeli soldiers intercepted missiles fired from Lebanon.
- Israeli army accused Hezbollah of operating within a civilian area.

title: Yemen Houthi rebels launch a missile that strikes an oil tanker in the Red Sea , US military says
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Yemen’s Houthi rebels hit an oil tanker in the Red Sea with a ballistic missile early Saturday, damaging the Panama-flagged, Greek-owned vessel in their latest assault over the Israel-Hamas war in the Gaza Strip, officials said.
The attack around 1 a.m. struck the oil tanker Wind, which recently docked in Russia and was bound for China, the U.S. military's Central Command said.
Both China and Russia maintain ties over military equipment and oil to Iran, the Houthis' main benefactor.
Houthi attacks have dropped in recent weeks as the rebels have been targeted by a U.S.-led airstrike campaign in Yemen.
Shipping through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden still remains low because of the threat, however.
event_breakdown:
- Houthi rebels in Yemen attacked an oil tanker off the coast of the Red Sea with a ballistic missile.
- The attack was aimed at the Panama-flagged, Greek-owned tanker Wind, which was docked in Russia and bound for China.
- The U.S. military's Central Command confirmed that the Houthis had carried out the attack.

title: Jenin : Terrorist eliminated in aerial strike
message:
תיעוד התקיפה בג'נין דובר צה"לThe IDF and ISA struck an operations center where terrorists operated in the area of Jenin, eliminating an important wanted terrorist who was responsible for numerous terror attacks.
Based on ISA intelligence, an IAF fighter jet and helicopter struck a compound used as an operations center of the terror infrastructure in Jenin.
During the strike, the terrorist Islam Khamayseh was eliminated.
The compound was a dangerous terrorist infrastructure, and its dismantling was carried out to remove an imminent threat posed by the terrorists who promoted terror attacks in the area of Jenin and Israeli territory.
"The IDF and ISA will continue operating to thwart any terror threat to Israeli civilians," the joint statement read.

title: Singapore boosts security following deadly Ulu Tiram police station attack
message:
SINGAPORE, May 18 — Singapore has stepped up security measures, including at the country’s checkpoints, following an attack at Ulu Tiram police station, Johor, yesterday which killed two police officers and injured another.
Singapore Home Affairs Ministry (MHA) today said these measures include increased patrols and enhanced checks on travellers and conveyances.
“Travellers should expect delays at the checkpoints due to enhanced checks, and factor in additional time needed for immigration clearance.

title: Houthis strike oil tanker with missle : U . S . military
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates -Yemen’s Houthi rebels hit an oil tanker in the Red Sea with a ballistic missile early Saturday, damaging the Panama-flagged, Greek-owned vessel in their latest assault over the Israel-Hamas war in the Gaza Strip, officials said.
The attack around 1 a.m. struck the oil tanker Wind, which recently docked in Russia and was bound for China, the U.S. military's Central Command said.
Both China and Russia maintain ties over military equipment and oil to Iran, the Houthis' main benefactor.
Houthi attacks have dropped in recent weeks as the rebels have been targeted by a U.S.-led airstrike campaign in Yemen.
Shipping through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden still remains low because of the threat, however.

4. Both China and Russia maintain ties over military equipment and oil to Iran, the Houthis' main benefactor.

title: Hamas commander killed in Israeli strike in Lebanon Bekaa
message:
Hamas’ armed wing, the Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades, stated that “commander” Sharhabil Sayed was killed by an Israeli aircraft targeting him in Lebanon’s West Bekaa area.
A source close to Hamas, who requested anonymity, told AFP that Sayed was a Hamas official overseeing Lebanon’s Bekaa region and was killed in an Israeli strike that hit his vehicle.
Earlier that day, Israeli strikes killed a Hezbollah fighter and two children, according to Hezbollah and official media sources.
In March, Hamas reported that one of its members was killed in an Israeli strike in southern Lebanon, which state media said killed three people.
A strike in January, attributed to Israel by a U.S. defense official, killed Hamas deputy leader Saleh al-Arouri and six other militants in Hezbollah’s stronghold in southern Beirut.

title: Jenin : Terrorist eliminated in aerial strike
message:
תיעוד התקיפה בג'נין דובר צה"לThe IDF and ISA struck an operations center where terrorists operated in the area of Jenin, eliminating an important wanted terrorist who was responsible for numerous terror attacks.
Based on ISA intelligence, an IAF fighter jet and helicopter struck a compound used as an operations center of the terror infrastructure in Jenin.
During the strike, the terrorist Islam Khamayseh was eliminated.
The compound was a dangerous terrorist infrastructure, and its dismantling was carried out to remove an imminent threat posed by the terrorists who promoted terror attacks in the area of Jenin and Israeli territory.
"The IDF and ISA will continue operating to thwart any terror threat to Israeli civilians," the joint statement read.
event_breakdown:
1. IAF fighter jets and helicopters struck a compound used as an operations center by the terror infrastructure in Jenin, based on ISA intelligence.
2. Terrorist Islam Khamayseh was eliminated during the strike against the compound.
3. The compound struck by the Israeli military posed an imminent threat due to its use by terrorists who promoted terror attacks in the area of Jenin and Israeli territory.

title: Nearly 800 , 000 Palestinians have fled Rafah since Israeli ground operation began - Unrwa
message:
Photograph: AFPNearly 800,000 Palestinians have evacuated Rafah since Israel launched a ground operation in the southern Gazan city on May 6th, the head of Unrwa, the UN agency providing food, shelter, education and welfare for Palestinian refugees, said on Saturday.
On Saturday, Israel’s forces took over some ground in Rafah, which had been sheltering more than one million displaced Gazans.
Residents in Rafah said Israeli tanks thrust into some of the eastern suburbs and clashed with Palestinian fighters there, while Israeli bombing from the air and ground persisted all night.
Once again, nearly half of the population of Rafah or 800,000 people are on the road, having been forced to flee since the Israeli Forces started the military operation in the area on 6 May.
Israel’s military said 281 soldiers have been killed in fighting since the first ground incursions in Gaza on October 20th.

* This operation forced 800,000 people (out of a population of 1.6 million) to flee their homes and become displaced

* Throughout Rafah, bombing from the air and ground persisted all night

title: The National Guard and Homeland Security
message:
Taking the Lead in Homeland SecurityThe National Guard is the logical element of the U.S. armed forces to act as the lead military agency for homeland security.
The Army National Guard, for example, maintains over 3,000 armories around the country, while the Air National Guard has 140 units throughout the United States and its territories.
To ensure that the National Guard's role evolves in a way that best supports the homeland security mission, the Administration should:Refocus the National Guard on homeland security.
Use National Guard resources wiselyThe Guard's resources should be focused on homeland security, not on missions better handled by the private sector or other government agencies.
The National Guard is well-suited to serving as the lead military agency for homeland security because its members live and work in communities.

title: Israel army says body of one hostage retrieved from Gaza
message:
A protester carries a menorah as relatives and supporters of Israeli hostages in Gaza demonstrate in Tel Aviv (JACK GUEZ)The Israeli army said Saturday that troops had retrieved the body of hostage Ron Benjamin from the war-torn Gaza Strip after he was "murdered" during the October 7 Hamas attack.
Benjamin was "murdered during the October 7th massacre at the Mefalsim intersection, and his body was abducted to Gaza by Hamas militants", the military said in a separate statement.
Fighters from Hamas crossed over from Gaza and killed more than 360 people at the festival, Israeli officials have said.
Out of the 252 people taken hostage that day, 124 are still being held inside the Gaza Strip, including 37 the army says are dead.
"As days go, we see more and more hostages are returning in body bags and more soldiers are being killed in Gaza," said Yotam Cohen, whose brother Nimrod is captive in Gaza.
event_breakdown:
* October 7 massacre at the Mefalsim intersection
* Israeli troops retrieve Ron Benjamin's body from the Gaza Strip
* 252 hostages were taken by Hamas fighters during the attack, of which 124 are still being held.
